p: During the SARS epidemic, in a cohort of 39 nondiabetic nonglucocorticoid-treated patients, 20 developed new-onset fasting hyperglycemia (>7 mmol/L), starting from the third day in the hospital and reversing by 2 weeks in the majority, whereas 2 patients continued to have diabetes 3 years later [ 92]. This was not observed in the control groups with non-SARS pneumonia, and healthy siblings of SARS patients. Postprandial plasma glucose, insulin levels, and insulin resistance were not reported.
